title: The Butterfly & The Caterpillar
description: A moral fable about a proud butterfly who forgot where she came from, and a wise caterpillar who reminds her that everyone has the potential to transform.

segments.text: One summer morning, a butterfly rested on a beautiful rose.

vocabulary.definition: Stopped for a while to regain energy

segments.text: While she sipped the sweet from the flower, she saw a caterpillar crawl up the garden wall.

vocabulary.definition: Drank a small amount of liquid at a time

segments.text: "Horrors!" the butterfly exclaimed, "Stop! Come near me. I'm ashamed to be seen where you are."

vocabulary.definition: Feeling bad or embarrassed about something

segments.text: The caterpillar continued crawling. He munched on the leaf without listening to the butterfly's cry.

vocabulary.definition: Moving slowly with the body close to the ground
Chewed or ate something steadily and noisily

segments.text: "Where are your wings? What are you eating?" the butterfly asked.

vocabulary.definition: The parts of a creature used for flying
Spoke to someone to get information

segments.text: The caterpillar walked ahead. Then he said, "Eight days ago, young butterfly, you were the same as I am."
"One night from today, my wings will grow. I would fly and see all the bright and beautiful flowers."

vocabulary.definition: To get bigger or more advanced over time
Giving off or reflecting a lot of light

segments.text: "I'm sure my wings would be brighter and more beautiful than yours. So go, fly, but try not to be so proud."

vocabulary.definition: Feeling deep satisfaction in your achievements

segments.text: "Each caterpillar is given a chance to become a butterfly."

quiz1.title: Pic-a-Word
quiz1.description: Choose the correct word to complete each sentence

questions.question: Each caterpillar will grow _______ someday.
questions.explanation: Wings are the parts of a creature used for flying.

questions.question: In the garden, the butterfly _______ on a flower.
questions.explanation: Rested means stopped for a while to regain energy.

questions.question: The caterpillar started _______ up the garden wall.
questions.explanation: Crawling means moving slowly with the body close to the ground.

questions.question: The little caterpillar _______ on the green leaf all morning.
questions.explanation: Munched means chewed or ate something steadily and noisily.

questions.question: The caterpillar reminded the butterfly that everyone gets a chance to _______ into something beautiful.
questions.explanation: Grow means to get bigger or more advanced over time.

quiz2.title: Decode the Word
quiz2.description: Read each sentence and choose what the underlined word means

questions.question: The caterpillar felt ashamed after laughing at others.
options: Feeling bad or embarrassed about something
questions.explanation: Ashamed means feeling bad or embarrassed about something.

questions.question: The caterpillar sipped water from a leaf.
options: Drank a small amount of liquid at a time
questions.explanation: Sipped means drank a small amount of liquid at a time.

questions.question: The caterpillar asked the butterfly a question.
options: Spoke to someone to get information
questions.explanation: Asked means spoke to someone to get information.

questions.question: The butterfly looked bright in the sunlight.
options: Giving off or reflecting a lot of light
questions.explanation: Bright means giving off or reflecting a lot of light.

questions.question: The butterfly felt proud after it changed.
options: Feeling deep satisfaction in your achievements
questions.explanation: Proud means feeling deep satisfaction in your achievements.

moralLesson: Do not be proud and forget where you came from. Everyone has the potential to transform and become something beautiful. We should treat others with kindness and remember our own humble beginnings.
